  • Constructor Details

    • LoginForm

      public LoginForm(Destination target, Exception entryException)
      This will construct a backing bean without any additional factors.
      Parameters:
      target - the target page
      entryException - the failure exception

  • Method Details

    • withFactor

      public LoginForm withFactor(@NotNull @PropertyKey(resourceBundle="locale.display") @NotNull @PropertyKey(resourceBundle="locale.display") String labelDisplayKey, @NotNull @NotNull String attributeName)
      This will construct a backing bean for the given target and exception. Note that a factor has a display key label for the prompt and a name for the attribute in the request. These arrays should match.
      Parameters:
      labelDisplayKey - a display key for the label for this factor
      attributeName - the attribute name for this factor

    • checkDirectHTTPLogin

      public void checkDirectHTTPLogin()
      Checks for username/password provided through the URL. If found, pre-populates the form and proceeds with login. For MFA it assumes that the request already has the appropriate additional factors

    • getRequest

      protected jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest getRequest()
      Return the HttpServletRequest if actually in a web request. Otherwise, will throw null pointer exceptions or return null.
      Returns:
      the HttpServletRequest if in a web request. Note: This is just in case we don't set this up the way some specific customer wants. They can still access the the request to setup it up in a subclass.

    • getTarget

      public Destination getTarget()

    • getEntryException

      public Exception getEntryException()

    • getAdditionalFactors

      public LoginForm.Factor[] getAdditionalFactors()
      This will return the additional factors if MFA is implemented.
      Returns:
      the additional factors

    • login

      public void login()
      Attempts to log the user in

    • getSpecialLoginExceptionMessage

      protected String getSpecialLoginExceptionMessage(LoginException exception)
      This should be overridden to return messages for any subclasses of LoginException not handled in getLoginExceptionMessage() before returning the default message by calling the super method.
      Parameters:
      exception - The exception thrown by the LoginManager.
      Returns:
      The appropriate String message for this subclass of LoginException.
